poem:
The Echo

Memory, brittle as frost,
Withholds the thing, 
Yet whispers its absence.
A shadow stirs,
More present in forgetting
Than the lost name,
A ghost in the mind's cathedral,
A silent toll:
The ringing of what is gone,
But known to be.
